definition: opponent/substantial adversary/worthy match/antagonist/in the enemy's hands
enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
see 棋逢對手|棋逢对手[qi2 feng2 dui4 shou3]

sentences.chinese: 他們以20比0大敗他們的敵手。

sentences.english: HujiangGuy：You should not crow over a defeated enemy.
sentences.chinese: 你不應該在被你擊敗的敵手面前大吹大擂。

sentences.english: I've entered all sorts of contests, even untill now I'm still unbeatable.
sentences.chinese: 我參加過各種比賽，到現在還打遍天下無敵手。

sentences.english: I have met the enemy and brought him to his knees.
sentences.chinese: 我已遭遇到敵手，並使他俯首稱臣。

sentences.english: He can outfox his opponent almost every time.
sentences.chinese: 他幾乎每次都能智取他的敵手。

sentences.english: The fort fell into the enemy's hands without a shot being fired.
sentences.chinese: 一槍未發堡壘就陷落敵手。

sentences.english: We"ve priced it at $ 98, almost 30% less than the competition."
sentences.chinese: 我們訂價爲98美元，幾近少於競爭敵手30%。

sentences.english: Beware of meat twice boiled, and an old foe reconciled.
sentences.chinese: 當心回鍋再煮的肉，以及與你和解的老敵手。

sentences.english: Even if the present, the match doesnot stop changes the page.
sentences.chinese: 即使目前，敵手也不停地翻動冊頁。

sentences.english: But then he let Mr Ozawa snipe at him from the campaign sidelines.
sentences.chinese: 但是他會使小澤一郎從他的選舉副手轉爲敵手。

sentences.english: That takes two or three decades of growth. Then, yesterday's allies can become today's rivals.
sentences.chinese: 經過二三十年的發展，昨日的同盟成爲今日的敵手。

sentences.english: In math I'm second to none in my class.
sentences.chinese: 在我班上，我的數學無敵手。

sentences.english: The city fell into enemy hands in April, and was regained in September.
sentences.chinese: 這座城市於4月陷入敵手，於9月收復。

sentences.english: So chanted the child to his antagonist.
sentences.chinese: 一位小孩向他的敵手誦唸這句話。

sentences.english: Suppose you were exposed in the opposite position by your opponent, .
sentences.chinese: 假設你被敵手敗露在相背的位置，。

sentences.english: Alexander the Great beat every opponent between Greece and India.
sentences.chinese: 亞歷山大大帝打敗了希臘和印度之間的每個敵手。

definition: to kill to the last one (idiom)/to exterminate/to eradicate/ruthless
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
to fight/to exchange blows
lit. two armies have equivalent banners and drums (idiom); fig. evenly matched/roughly comparable (opponents)
to glare like a tiger watching his prey (idiom)/to eye covetously
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
to stake all on one throw

Feast at Hongmen/(fig.) banquet set up with the aim of murdering a guest/refers to a famous episode in 206 BC when future Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] escaped attempted murder by his rival Xiang Yu 項羽|项羽[Xiang4 Yu3]
powerful enemy
to strive
to deliver a punishing attack/to deal a heavy blow
to be determined to win (idiom)
many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
a thorn in one's side
